comments.content: the emp table is the left table and it the one wich needs to be preserved: The placement of the employees table on the left and the managers table on the right in the query is determined by the structure of the JOIN clause and the logic of the query.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about indexes and their administration in an Oracle database? (Choose two.)

choices.C: If a query filters on an indexed column, the index will always be accessed during execution of the query.
choices.E: The same table column cannot be part of a unique and non-unique index.
choices.B: An INVINSIBLE index is maintained by DML operations on the underlying table.
choices.D: A DROP INDEX statement always prevents updates to the table during the drop operation.
choices.A: A new index can be created or an existing one reused when a primary key constraint is created.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct

Selected Answer: AC
A: using index clause
C: once index created, use is automatic with query

comments.content:
Zouve's comments regarding choice C are absolutely correct. My mistake!
AB

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
c. No, that statement is not necessarily true. If a query filters on an indexed column, the optimizer will decide whether or not to use the index based on factors such as the selectivity of the filter and the size of the table. In some cases, a full table scan may be more efficient than using an index.

Selected Answer: AB
AB are correct
